responses.content: Thank you for the question. In Q1 2024, we've seen significant strides in AI and machine learning technologies. Our latest GPU architectures have enabled faster training times and more efficient inference, allowing our customers to deploy AI solutions more rapidly. We're particularly excited about the integration of our new Tensor Cores, which enhance performance for deep learning applications. Additionally, our collaboration with leading research institutions has led to breakthroughs in natural language processing and computer vision, further solidifying NVIDIA's position at the forefront of AI innovation.

Our data center business continues to outperform expectations. In Q1, we achieved a 25% year-over-year growth, driven by increased adoption of our Hopper architecture. The demand for high-performance computing in sectors such as healthcare, finance, and autonomous vehicles remains robust. We're also expanding our partnerships with major cloud service providers to ensure our solutions are readily available to a broader audience. Looking ahead, we anticipate sustained growth as more organizations transition to AI-driven infrastructures.

The gaming sector remains a cornerstone of our business. In Q1 2024, gaming revenue grew by 15% compared to the previous quarter, supported by the launch of our new GeForce RTX 50 series. These GPUs offer unparalleled ray tracing and AI-enhanced graphics, providing gamers with an immersive experience. We're also investing in game development partnerships to optimize titles specifically for NVIDIA hardware, ensuring our technologies are leveraged to their full potential.

Sustainability is a key focus for NVIDIA. In Q1, we made significant progress in reducing our carbon footprint by optimizing our manufacturing processes and increasing the use of renewable energy in our data centers. We've also launched several initiatives aimed at recycling and repurposing electronic waste, aligning with our commitment to environmental responsibility. These efforts not only benefit the planet but also enhance the efficiency and longevity of our products.

Looking forward, we're excited about the upcoming releases in our product lineup. Our next-generation GPUs will feature enhanced AI capabilities and improved energy efficiency, catering to the evolving needs of our customers. Additionally, we're developing new software tools that will simplify the integration of AI into various applications, making advanced technologies accessible to a wider range of industries. Stay tuned for more announcements in the coming quarters as we continue to innovate and lead the market.

Thank you all for your continued support and interest in NVIDIA. We're committed to driving technological advancements and delivering exceptional value to our shareholders, customers, and partners. As we navigate the dynamic landscape of technology and innovation, we remain focused on our mission to transform industries and improve lives through the power of AI and accelerated computing. We look forward to sharing more updates in our future earnings calls.

Thank you. In Q1 2024, NVIDIA reported revenues of $8.5 billion, representing a 20% increase year-over-year. Gross margins remained strong at 68%, driven by higher-margin data center sales and efficient cost management across our operations. Operating expenses were well-controlled, with R&D investments increasing to support our long-term innovation strategy. Net income for the quarter was $3.2 billion, reflecting our commitment to delivering robust financial performance.

We've continued our balanced approach to capital allocation, focusing on reinvestment in our business while returning value to shareholders. In Q1, we repurchased $1 billion of our stock, utilizing approximately 14% of our available share repurchase authorization. Additionally, we increased our quarterly dividend by 5%, reaffirming our confidence in NVIDIA's growth prospects and our commitment to rewarding our shareholders.

Our cash flow from operations was $4.5 billion in Q1, providing us with ample liquidity to support our strategic initiatives. We maintain a strong balance sheet with $12 billion in cash and equivalents, ensuring we have the flexibility to pursue opportunities that drive long-term value. Our debt levels remain manageable, and we continue to optimize our working capital to support ongoing growth.

Looking ahead to Q2 2024, we are guiding for revenues in the range of $9.0 billion to $9.5 billion, reflecting continued momentum in our data center and gaming businesses. Gross margins are expected to remain stable around 68%, supported by a favorable product mix and operational efficiencies. We anticipate operating expenses to grow moderately as we invest in expanding our product portfolio and scaling our operations to meet increasing demand.

We remain vigilant in managing risks associated with supply chain disruptions and component shortages. Our proactive approach to inventory management and supplier diversification has mitigated potential impacts, allowing us to maintain production schedules and meet customer demand effectively. Additionally, we continue to monitor geopolitical developments and market dynamics to navigate any challenges that may arise.

In summary, NVIDIA is well-positioned for sustained growth in 2024. Our financial performance reflects the strength of our strategic initiatives and the increasing adoption of our technologies across various industries. We remain committed to driving innovation, delivering value to our shareholders, and maintaining our leadership position in the market. Thank you.
